question_text: Tell me about yourself.
What three words would your friends use to describe you?
What is your greatest strength and weakness?
What book has influenced you the most?
How would you describe your learning style?
What do you do for fun outside of school?
What accomplishment are you most proud of?
How do you handle stress or pressure?
Why are you interested in this field of study?
What sparked your interest in this major?
Why do you want to attend our university?
What do you hope to gain from your college experience?
What makes you a good fit for this program?
What specific courses or opportunities at our school excite you most?
How will you contribute to our campus community?
What other schools are you considering and why?
Describe a time you faced a significant challenge.
Tell me about a time you worked in a team.
Describe a leadership experience.
Tell me about a time you failed and what you learned.
Describe a situation where you had to work with someone difficult.
Tell me about a time you had to make a difficult decision.
Describe a time you stepped outside your comfort zone.
Tell me about a time you had to manage competing priorities.
Describe a time you helped resolve a conflict.
Tell me about a time you showed initiative.
What are your career goals?
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?
How do you plan to make an impact in your field?
What problem in the world would you most like to solve?
How will your education here help you achieve your goals?
What kind of legacy do you want to leave?
Tell me about a technical project you've worked on.
What programming languages are you familiar with and what have you built?
Describe an engineering challenge you've tackled.
What current scientific or technological development excites you most?
How do you approach problem-solving in technical contexts?
What business leader do you admire and why?
What economic issue concerns you most and how would you address it?
Describe an entrepreneurial or business experience you've had.
How do you plan to take advantage of MIT's hands-on approach to learning?
How would you contribute to MIT's maker culture?
How would Stanford's interdisciplinary approach benefit your education?
How do you see yourself using Stanford's d.school resources?
How would you take advantage of Harvard's house system?
What does veritas (truth) mean to you in the context of your education?
How do Princeton’s commitments to service and civic engagement align with your goals?
How would you use Princeton’s integration of engineering with the liberal arts to approach innovation?
Yale emphasizes intellectual curiosity as a lifelong pursuit. Can you share a moment that reflects this quality in you?
Yale values interdisciplinary exploration. How might you connect the humanities with other areas of knowledge here?
How do you see yourself engaging with Columbia’s Core Curriculum both intellectually and personally?
Columbia encourages the fusion of research and societal impact. What social issue would you use science to address?
How do you approach intellectual challenges in the spirit of UChicago’s ‘life of the mind’?
UChicago is known for rigorous inquiry in economics—how would you apply that mindset to today’s global economic issues?
How would Penn’s ‘One University’ philosophy influence the way you pursue your academic interests?
Wharton emphasizes leadership through innovation. What problem would you tackle through entrepreneurial thinking?
How do collaboration and curiosity drive your approach to science and discovery, as they do at Caltech?
Caltech values rigor and creativity in problem-solving. Can you describe a time you combined both?
How does Duke’s focus on knowledge in service to society resonate with your academic or personal passions?
How would you take advantage of Northwestern’s flexible curriculum to design your own academic journey?
How would you use Northwestern’s integration of communication theory and practice to address a real-world issue?
How would you engage with Dartmouth’s close-knit community to enhance both your learning and others’ experiences?
How does Brown’s Open Curriculum align with your approach to intellectual exploration?
Cornell values ‘any person, any study.’ How does that philosophy reflect in your academic or personal journey?
How would Johns Hopkins’ research-first approach shape your development as a scholar?
Medicine at Hopkins is rooted in discovery. What health challenge would you most like to investigate?
How would you engage in Rice’s tight-knit residential community while pursuing academic excellence?
How could Vanderbilt’s emphasis on collaboration and innovation enhance your college experience?
Notre Dame emphasizes ethical leadership rooted in faith and reason. How do you see those values guiding you?
How will you engage with UCLA’s culture of diversity and public service?
Berkeley encourages students to challenge convention. When have you done that in your own life?
How does Georgetown’s Jesuit tradition of cura personalis — care for the whole person — resonate with your goals?
CMU values applying computer science for societal benefit. What real-world issue would you build technology to improve?
How do Emory’s strengths in both research and community engagement align with your vision of impact?
WashU emphasizes learning by doing. How have hands-on experiences shaped your academic growth?
WashU is known for bridging engineering and medicine. What health challenge would you want to address through bioengineering?
Michigan’s tradition of ‘Leaders and Best’ emphasizes both excellence and public service. How do you embody those ideals?
The CSE program at Michigan encourages collaboration and impact. How have you used technology to improve your community?
NYU thrives on its integration with the city. How would you take advantage of New York’s energy and diversity in your studies?
NYU Stern emphasizes real-world impact. How would you connect classroom concepts to solve a global business problem?
USC values the convergence of creativity and innovation. How have you combined imagination and technical skill to create something new?
USC’s School of Cinematic Arts stands at the intersection of storytelling and technology. How do you plan to use film to influence culture?

university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
question_text: Carolina’s mission centers on ‘light and liberty.’ What idea or cause do you hope to illuminate through your education?

university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
question_text: UNC’s Gillings School focuses on real-world health solutions. What public health challenge inspires you most to solve?
Jefferson’s vision for UVA was to foster citizen leaders. How do you define leadership in service of others?
UVA’s programs encourage deep civic understanding. What political issue would you most like to explore—and why?
UT Austin’s motto is ‘What starts here changes the world.’ What change do you hope to start?
The Cockrell School champions innovation through collaboration. How do you build and work effectively on engineering teams?
Georgia Tech’s motto is ‘Progress and Service.’ How do you balance technological progress with social responsibility?
Georgia Tech emphasizes real-world application. Describe a project where you designed or optimized a system for efficiency.
CMU’s interdisciplinary ethos blends creativity and computation. How would you merge art and technology to express an idea or solve a problem?
Tufts encourages active citizenship. How do you approach using your talents for social good?
Tufts’ Fletcher School fosters global engagement. What international issue compels you to act?
Boston College’s Jesuit tradition emphasizes ‘men and women for others.’ How do you strive to serve others through your ambitions?
BU’s global orientation encourages students to engage beyond borders. How do you view your education as a global citizen?
BU’s College of Communication emphasizes truth-seeking in journalism. What story or issue do you feel compelled to tell?
How would you use the Medill School’s focus on innovation and impact to tell stories that inspire change?
Rutgers’ history is rooted in public service. How do you see your education addressing issues in your community?
The Kelley School focuses on integrity in business decision-making. How do ethics guide your understanding of success?
The Wisconsin Idea connects education to public good. How would you use your education to improve lives beyond campus?
UIUC engineers are change-makers. What engineering problem fascinates you most and how would you approach solving it?
